Dear Sir
I am sending under separate cover, five tape recordings done
during a summer trip to PrnHce, Italy and Yugoslavia last year,
I believe they have p^irticular interest for a college age
audience since they are interviews with American,French, Italian,
and Yugoslavian students, iind they do go into some detail on a
program for college age youth and young adults known as "Exper¬
iment in International Living," which this year is observing
its 25th anniversary.
Over the past 25 years this organization has placed 40,000
young people in family homes in foreign countries to spend
their summer vacations and to gain greater insights into the
way other people live and think and feel.
I have enclosed a description of each tape r, s well as suggested
opening and closing announcements.
The trip was made independent of the EXPERIMENT office, but
they were extremely helpful in assisting me to meet and talk
with their groip s.
I wrote your office before Imade the trip last summer, and
was told that there would be interest in auditioning these
tapes.
After you have reviewed them would you be kind enough to let
me know if this is sujtible material for programming through your
organization, and what the Association would be able to pay for
this m pterial.
I also would like to have these tapes returned to me when you
hr,ve finished using them.
If five tapes are not sufficient I shall be able to supplement
these with interviews with American students from around Boston,
who made these trips liust year concentrating on their memories
and experiences in actually living as a member of a foreign
family for the summer, and I can also arrange interviews with
young people getting ready for similar trips this suraiper. Perhaps
combining a young student preparing to go go a specific country
with someone who was there last year might make interesting
program material.
